nodes.text:
[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSkyfog],Skyfog]]'s innermost moon has been scanned and the results look promising so far.

Farah, I think we found [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreProjectUMBRELLA],Libra UMBRELLA]].
[A grainy amplification of the moon's surface fills the viewscreen. A large structure fills the screen, looking like a dead whale washed in the shore.]

The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreArgo],Argo]]... and nearly intact after almost three hundred years being left down there?

I just wish Kamea and Alexander were here to see this, it is exactly as they talked about it.

And from the looks of it, it could be the game changer the [[DM.Factions[faction_AuriganRestoration],Restoration]] needs.

Look at the hull size... I wonder how many [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBattleMech],'Mechs]] it can hold.

That's quite a big [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDropShip],DropShip]] to land, I'd assume it crashed.

Although it does look a lot better than I would have expected if it has been sitting there for centuries.

branches.responseText: Dr. Murad, what's your estimation of that ship's condition?

nodes.text:
This is nearly impossible to believe... all sensors indicate that the ship is operational or most systems are, despite the crash....

Sumire, is it possible the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSLDF],SLDF]] landed the DropShip deliberately on this moon?

If that DropShip wasn't designed for planetary landings, you would just have to find a pilot desperate or crazy enough to attempt such a maneuver.

Wait... there is something else down there!
[Several locations around the image became lit with red icons representing contacts.]

That's a company of BattleMechs parked down there... that just lowers our chances greatly of being able to salvage that prize.

Sensors have already picked up radar towers and we can't land nearby until we deal with whatever air defense they have down there.

We can't just leave that treasure down there.

That nearly intact DropShip is the key for Kamea to save the Reach and its people from the [[DM.Factions[faction_AuriganDirectorate],Directorate]] and the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurians]].

branches.responseText: You all know Lady Arano's orders, we need to come up with a solution.

nodes.text:
I knew our luck wouldn't last long.

Incoming tight beam transmission, they know we're here.
Sumire, is it from the DropShip's location? Have they detected us?

Negative XO, it's orbital, they're likely hiding somewhere.

Putting it to main screen now.
[Holovid switches to incoming video transmission.]
Hysteria, tvo yoo mat! Why are you here?
Tell me exactly who gave you these coordinates, and I might not blow you up right now with the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBadKitty],Bad Kitty]]'s guns!

branches.responseText: Captain Murray, we're here on orders of Lady Arano...

nodes.text: Oh, it's lady Arano now, da? So Commander, have you been promoted to Captain Kloun as well?

Captain Murray, I'm sure a generous financial compromise could be arranged with Lady Arano in exchange for the use of your [[DM.Factions[faction_TortugaPirates],Satan's Kittens]] in securing that DropShip to the Restoration.

I apologize, I didn't remember that the XO was the kloun in your circus and your Commander {COMMANDER.LastName} is just a tamed puppy jumping around at Arano's orders. So, all of you klouns can leave now before my kittens get angry!

Captain Murray, after hearing your voice so many times, I still can't recognize your accent from anywhere in nearby space.

And even more interesting, after a search I couldn't find any historical records of you or the Satan's Kittens and or any evidence that links you to the [[DM.Factions[faction_TortugaDominion],Tortuga Dominion]].

Why would that be, Kitten Actual? 

I wonder if Lady [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLadyDeath],Paula Trevaline]] could clear this for us if we sent an [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHPG],HPG]] to her.

Lady Death has no time to lose with fools like you and neither have I. I'm guessing the Doctor is the reason why lady Arano decided to send you all on your little [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLosTech],LosTech]] quest to this moon?

Captain Murray, the Bad Kitty is too far to catch us unless you want to risk alerting the attention of those unknown forces down there. Which is unlikely to be your decision, considering that your location allows your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreUnion],Union]]'s sensors to stay undetected while keeping an eye on the planet and how you want us to leave.

branches.responseText: Captain Murray, what are your intentions here?

nodes.text:
Aren't you all just cute all of a sudden?

Very well, you can take down the [[DM.Factions[faction_HarbingersOfDoom],Harbingers]] if you want them but I will repeat: that DropShip is off the table.

branches.responseText: Lady Arano has ordered us to fight to recover it.

nodes.text: Captain Kloun, I couldn't care less of what your mistress wants. As to my intentions... *laughter*.
Very well, the DropShip can be yours to take to your lady for you assisting me with clearing the Harbingers off that moon.

Captain Kloun, your arrival put an end to several months of mindless boredom while waiting for my real prey to arrive. It also forces me to play my hand against the [[DM.Factions[faction_HarbingersOfDoom],Harbingers]] now.

Murray, you're honestly letting go of an nearly intact DropShip of that size as payment for mercenary work???

What is down there that is worth that much to you?

Something in here clearly doesn't add up, Captain Murray, as the XO said.

What are your real motives behind your presence here?
Mr. Oliveira, Dr. Murad, either we take that crash site together or you can try to take it alone and you will fail.

branches.responseText: You know we can defeat you.

nodes.text: Boring... I'm done talking to you, Captain Kloun. Time to burn stuff, try not to get on the way or you will get burned, capiche?
[Transmission signal ended.]

Well, we should have known that it wasn't going to be that easy but adding Laura Murray into the mix?

That just made this contract go down in flames.
At least this time she is giving us kinda of a better choice. Either we join with her against the Harbingers or we try to take the Argo from whomever is left standing.

Darius, and you trust she'll actually consider giving the Argo to the Restoration after she's done using us to recover it for her? I'm glad I won't be the one having to explain Lady Arano if she changes her mind again, once we're done with the Harbingers.
Right now trusting her is a question of faith because the Bad Kitty just ignited its fusion engines. No pressure, but what do you want me to do, boss?

branches.responseText: [Story Decision: Refuse Murray's terms.] It looks like we'll have to take the Argo from the Satan's Kittens.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Accept Murray's terms.]</color> I don't really trust her but she's in control of the situation.

nodes.text: We'll have to engage both the Kittens and the Harbingers and she's might get to the crash site first than us.
Aye, aye, Commander, although trusting her will be quite a question of faith. I'll reply to the Bad Kitty while they're still in range.
Against her and the Harbingers we'd better start believing we can achieve this.

Not very professional, are you, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}?

I guess that should be expected... you better leave before I give you my reply...

The bigger mistake would be to allow the Harbingers or her to obtain this ship and use it for their proposes.

Let's not forget about that while we're fighting alongside her.
